column4: It was a pleasure to join President Woo & @SweetBriaredu faculty to tour the school’s new state-of-the-art health clinic. In partnership with @Centra Health and @Horizon_BH, this facility will enable the college to expand both COVID-19 testing & mental health services on campus. https://t.co/fnGFyrc7Vd

The Central Shenandoah Health District is hosting three free COVID-19 testing events throughout the Sixth District this week. Testing locations will be in Lexington, Harrisonburg, and Stuarts Draft. For more information, click below. https://t.co/TCmVzaEm1h

On this #NationalFarmersDay, we thank the millions of farmers and ranchers across the country whose tireless efforts have kept the American food supply chain strong throughout the COVID-19 pandemic. Our Nation is forever grateful. https://t.co/TJOgbUPxxE

Supporting farmers & ranchers throughout the Sixth District remains one of my top priorities. That's why I recently cosponsored the PRIME Act, which makes it easier for local producers to get their meat to market & promotes a stable food supply chain amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/I4xc18NBSQ

The Central Shenandoah Health District is hosting four free COVID-19 testing events throughout the Sixth District this coming week. Testing locations will be in Waynesboro, Verona, Lexington, and Harrisonburg. For more information, click below. https://t.co/hi7Fz1q8ug

Rebuilding and restoring our economy to pre COVID-19 levels is a top priority. Today’s unemployment news shows we remain headed in the right direction. From its height of nearly 15%, the number of jobless Americans fell to 7.9% and I'm confident this downward trend will continue. https://t.co/RxHPOLA4iU
President Trump is an amazing fighter! Our thoughts and prayers are with @realDonaldTrump and @FLOTUS as they battle COVID-19. Godspeed, Mr. President! https://t.co/i68QkRdjOQ

Ignoring pleas to work in a bipartisan manner to pass critical COVID-19 relief legislation, Speaker Pelosi once again chose politics over the American people by forcing through a bloated boondoggle. These shameful political games are hurting American families & small businesses. https://t.co/nmHuZO9VDR

The Central Shenandoah Health District is hosting four free COVID-19 testing events throughout the Sixth District this week. Testing locations will be in Waynesboro, Craigsville, Buena Vista, and Penn Laird. For more information, click below. https://t.co/JgomW4sjLG

The @USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program, which provides critical support to our Nation’s farmers and ensures Americans have access to the food they need, will receive an additional $14 billion today. Click below to apply for aid. https://t.co/AGemIVUKqJ

In our latest effort to lower drug prices, I joined 243 of my colleagues in writing to @HHSGov urging @SecAzar to take immediate action to stop drug companies from limiting access to discount pricing to hospitals, health centers, and clinics. https://t.co/wfbHiP9f3V
A bipartisan thank you to the folks working on the front lines during this pandemic and a reminder for everyone to be safe this Labor Day holiday! https://t.co/hg7UI1jmZ2

The White House will begin offering tours again starting September 12th. Hours and groups will be very limited and CDC guidelines will be in place. Please visit the White House website for more information.
https://t.co/niEr0M7wjO

The @DeptVetAffairs remains committed to providing our servicemembers with the quality healthcare they deserve. I am pleased to see the agency utilizing its resources to help both veterans and civilians by testing potential COVID-19 treatments. https://t.co/kTu74UfawQ

Tours of all federal buildings, including of the U.S. Capitol & White House, remain suspended due to COVID-19. Any tour of the Capitol Building booked for before September 30 has unfortunately been canceled. Please continue to check my website for updates. https://t.co/YpxJc7EZ4v

This week, free COVID-19 testing is available in Harrisonburg. You can register by calling 1-855-949-8378. Registration closes Thursday at 12:00pm. 
https://t.co/f0p8LCSFps

The Virginia Employment Commission is investigating 3,000 cases of unemployment benefit fraud throughout the Commonwealth. Scammers are attempting to take advantage of the COVID-19 pandemic, so please stay vigilant and report suspected fraud. 
https://t.co/bnQxwEP53y

In early spring, the @StauntonKiwanis teamed up with Martin’s Foods to stock the concession stand at Gypsy Hill Park for the little league season opener. But when COVID-19 hit and the season was canceled, the group decided to live out their motto “to serve the kids” in a new way. https://t.co/W0EgfaxPaZ

Hearing from the constituents of Virginia’s Sixth District is important to me. While Congress continues to address the COVID-19 pandemic, what other issues should the House be focusing on? Take the survey below and let me know! https://t.co/4ePmhjivfM

I am pleased to see that the @DeptVetAffairs will suspend certain debt collections under the jurisdiction of the @USTreasury through the end of 2020 for veterans who have been adversely impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. For more information, click below. https://t.co/GxOU2uNWdv

Thank you to everyone who participated in my third Coronavirus Update Telephone Town Hall this afternoon. I hope you all found the call helpful and informative as we navigate this crisis. For more information regarding COVID-19, please visit my website https://t.co/NYfZVwiwzK. https://t.co/mLByM8KiGW

The Paycheck Protection Program has served as a lifeline during the COVID-19 pandemic to millions of small businesses across the country. I am pleased that Congress voted yesterday to extend the application deadline for this resource until August 8. https://t.co/pnYZIe8e2b

After months of being closed because of COVID-19, I was pleased to see the @OmniHomestead reopen its doors yesterday with safety precautions in place. As Bath County’s largest employer, this is great news for its 700 employees and the region as a whole. https://t.co/d0225n4hAz

It was a pleasure to join the @RoanokeChamber and @RepMGriffith on a video-call to hear first-hand from small business owners and to answer questions regarding the federal resources that are available amidst the COVID-19 pandemic. https://t.co/fJmr254tRO

The Federal Government continues to make resources available to help businesses affected by COVID-19, and the @SBAgov is once again accepting applications for the Economic Injury Disaster Loan program from all qualified businesses. Apply below: https://t.co/YruHMSwRYD

With so many of our region’s summer festivities canceled because of COVID-19 concerns, I am very pleased to see that the Shenandoah County Fair will carry on as planned. Be sure to mark your calendars for the end of August! https://t.co/dR0PW069Qw

Kudos to Eagle Rock Elementary School teacher, Amy Warren, for going above and beyond during the coronavirus pandemic. Her commitment and one-on-one attention to her special needs students turned remote learning into an opportunity rather than a setback. https://t.co/8l59q1qDOK

The @USDA is accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program until August 28. If you are a farmer or rancher who has been adversely impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, I would encourage you to apply for financial relief here: https://t.co/Y2XtAdiRhr https://t.co/hBel83R2Gd

Hiring is officially underway for the new @MackTrucks facility in the Roanoke Valley. Opening its doors on September 1st following delays caused by the coronavirus, this $13 million investment will create 250 jobs and is welcomed news for Valley residents. https://t.co/Qrm05TabKb

After months of adhering to strict guidelines to slow the spread of COVID-19, I am pleased to see that most of Virginia will enter Phase Two of the reopening process this Friday. To learn more about what Phase Two entails, follow the link below. https://t.co/uG4XZx0KAm

As part of the Coronavirus Farm Assistance Program, the @USDA created the Farmers to Families Food Box initiative to help those affected by the pandemic. Today, I enjoyed the opportunity to join volunteers at @TRBC in Lynchburg to help distribute 7,000 meals to folks in need. https://t.co/VZmPD5eCku

It was a pleasure to chat with students from @RUCRoanoke’s Physician Assistant Program this week. We discussed the need to develop and expand PA education in Virginia, which is an important component in ensuring our rural communities have access to the health care they need. https://t.co/i5hKEFe6st

Throughout the coronavirus pandemic, the @DeptVetAffairs has been hard at work making sure our Nation’s veterans receive top-notch care, while performing nearly 175,000 COVID-19 tests. https://t.co/kpL8tMZCp3 https://t.co/ib7hxgKyXA

Please visit the new COVIDCheck website below if you believe you may have contracted the coronavirus. This risk-assessment tool will allow you to check your symptoms, find a testing facility, and answer any questions you may have. https://t.co/wtBcsTuntP https://t.co/TryzXedmDO

Rural America has been particularly hard hit by the economic impact of COVID-19. I'm pleased to see that @USDA will be making $1 billion in loan guarantees available to rural businesses & ag producers who have been crucial in maintaining our food supply. https://t.co/K6Hp6cNskB

I agree with Rep. Porter (D-CA) and the bipartisan majority of the Virginia Congressional Delegation that voted against H.R. 6800. COVID-19 relief bills must target the economic and health situation we’re facing with input from both sides of the aisle. https://t.co/6LvH0BJO1b

In a medical emergency, time is of the essence and EMS personnel are tasked with the harrowing duty of providing lifesaving care before a patient reaches the hospital. On this EMS Week, we recognize their service, and we thank them for their efforts in the fight against COVID-19. https://t.co/f7i7zlCyLN

The @USDA has announced details of the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. This program will make $16 billion in aid available to America’s farmers and ranchers impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. To learn more, please visit the link below. https://t.co/bx3qmUluJt

As health care professionals, first responders, and others continue to battle the coronavirus, the Federal Government remains committed to providing the states with the resources necessary to keep front-line workers safe. https://t.co/i0alxoHZVs

The @DeptVetAffairs announced that it will begin to reintroduce limited health care services at select locations across the country. One such facility that will reopen next week with proper safety guidelines in place is the @VASalem. Learn more below. https://t.co/tGfNJDYo4M

This evening, I am voting against House Democrats’ socialist wish-list. This bill explodes the size of Government, while spending billions on liberal programs unrelated to the coronavirus. https://t.co/vo5AJJOKw8

As portions of Virginia enter Phase One today and businesses begin to reopen, please continue to take safety precautions and follow the guidelines below. Together we can ensure the Commonwealth avoids further spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/hOtplJemZU

Most folks who contract COVID-19 will be able to recover at home. This often means friends or family will serve as caregivers, and as such, face a higher likelihood of exposure. Please watch the @CDCgov’s video below to learn how you can best protect yourself in this situation. https://t.co/cb1yyewkPd

The @USDA will host a Zoom webinar today at 1pm for farmers, ranchers, and other producers interested in applying for Direct Payments through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. For more information and registration details, click here: https://t.co/BnHUq9nkzx https://t.co/WSDMBPpBc8

In an effort to help civilians and veterans deal with the stresses of daily life caused by the coronavirus, the @DeptVetAffairs has launched a mobile app called COVID Coach. To learn more and to find available resources, visit the link below. https://t.co/8HOjLRtvhE

Hospitals have seen a decrease in emergency room visits for serious medical conditions such as heart attacks, strokes, and traumatic injuries. In a health emergency, time is of the essence. Please do not let fear of COVID-19 stop you from seeking medical attention when needed. https://t.co/Wf0m14aIrU

If you are a business preparing to reopen, I’d encourage you to review a few tips from the @CDCgov on how to best protect employees and customers. By taking a few simple precautions, you can minimize health risks to both workers and the public. https://t.co/tbcjaJmMKY

I recently joined @ABC13News to discuss the COVID-19 pandemic and the resources that are available to help individuals and small businesses. As our Nation gets back to work, we can ensure that the American people have the tools they need to triumph over this evolving crisis. https://t.co/Bc8Bm6kb7H

Kudos to 8-year-old Noah Ryman of Woodstock and Shenandoah Memorial Hospital (SMH). Noah donated his piggy bank savings to the hospital with a note saying, “For the sick people that need it.” SMH personnel began matching the donation and raised $3,000. https://t.co/2UGh9eqSZc

Combating the rise in domestic violence during the pandemic has never been as important as it is right now. That’s why I teamed up with @RepLucyMcBath to introduce the POWER Act, which ensures that victims of abuse have continued access to resources during this ongoing crisis. https://t.co/GCO4lEgx2z

Telemedicine is the future of health care in rural areas where needed services & providers can be difficult to find. We must ensure this resource remains available moving forward, & to do so Congress must work together to promote rural access to broadband. https://t.co/TsWEuNTTYg

On this National Day of Prayer, we lift up all those affected by COVID-19, whether physically, financially, or emotionally.
 
"Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest." ~ Matthew 11:28 https://t.co/KgodmG0btH

Our First Amendment guarantees Americans the right to exercise their religion free from government interference. I am pleased that the U.S. Justice Department agrees. We can encourage safe health practices while upholding our constitutional liberties. https://t.co/99v0J8Mcqr

Today marks the beginning of Nurses Appreciation Week. The stories shared by nurses over the past two months highlight their unwavering commitment to their patients and exemplify the critical role they play in our health care system. Nurses, thank you for all you do. https://t.co/c3s5A2CzYe

Yesterday, I urged Secretary Bernhardt to reopen @ShenandoahNPS. Adhering to social-distancing guidelines in an open-air space of this size would certainly be manageable, and reopening the park would go a long way in keeping folks both mentally and physically healthy. https://t.co/iy0W44dpMf

Recently, I introduced the POWER Act with @RepLucyMcBath. This bill temporarily suspends non-federal match requirements for domestic violence services grants, which will ensure victims continue to have the resources they need amidst this pandemic. https://t.co/eAGBap0LYP

May is Mental Health Awareness Month. As COVID-19 continues to put a strain on our daily lives, please know that there are resources available if you need help. @samhsagov’s emergency hotline is available 24/7 and can be reached at 1-800-662-HELP (4357). https://t.co/OkszzGc9XM

Today, I introduced the Use Your Endowment Act. This legislation ensures that colleges and universities with multibillion-dollar endowments can no longer take advantage of coronavirus relief funding at the expense of America’s small businesses & taxpayers. https://t.co/fTAZ8WcaOm

Telemedicine is becoming an increasingly popular alternative to in-person doctor’s office visits - especially during this pandemic. To learn about telemedicine and to find out if this option is right for you, click here: https://t.co/ekSJvJS9jD https://t.co/bEsLObOSnV

Far too often scammers prey on vulnerable populations like senior citizens. Fortunately, @TheJusticeDept’s Elder Justice Initiative is working to protect older Americans from fraud, including from scams related to COVID-19. Learn more below. https://t.co/qaPDatuWta

While food delivery services have made getting groceries easier during this pandemic, most folks still need to go to the store to pick up supplies. Please visit the @US_FDA’s website below for tips on how to protect yourself while shopping. https://t.co/bQaoRZ6ish

The @CDCgov has officially recognized 6 new symptoms of COVID-19. These include chills, repeated shaking with chills, muscle pain, headache, sore throat, & loss of taste or smell. If you experience any of these symptoms, contact your health care provider. https://t.co/F2juG2YxMk
RT @WhiteHouse: LIVE: Press Briefing with Coronavirus Task Force https://t.co/mLfPSV05Lj

Are you interested in aiding the coronavirus relief effort? If so, click the link below to learn about the many ways you can help your community in need. #NationalVolunteerMonth https://t.co/AMXgMkamT6 https://t.co/CAub3sQSVZ

The Paycheck Protection Program & Health Care Enhancement Act ensures small businesses & hospitals have the resources necessary to win this fight against COVID-19.

✅$310B for PPP
✅$60B for EIDL
✅$75B for hospitals
✅$25B for expanded testing https://t.co/geqhts3vpm

The @US_FDA is asking for your help. If you have fully recovered from COVID-19, please consider donating plasma. Your contribution could save lives. To learn more and to find a donation center near you, click here: https://t.co/LjXv9JmlvH https://t.co/sWstmYmzRE

Our fight against the coronavirus is far from over. Infection and death rates are still rising in VA, so I encourage everyone to continue practicing safe health habits & social distancing. Working together, we can beat this virus & reopen VA for business! https://t.co/QGXtevFCqS
RT @WhiteHouse: LIVE: Press Briefing with Coronavirus Task Force https://t.co/SB1Rg3e3v4
RT @WhiteHouse: LIVE: Press Briefing with Coronavirus Task Force https://t.co/IeIElzruLM

Yesterday, I had the privilege of touring @TheOrvisCompany’s fulfillment center in Roanoke. Orvis has begun producing masks and is donating them to @RescueMission48 and other local nonprofits. Thank you for your contribution to the Sixth District and the COVID-19 relief effort. https://t.co/7eM7WJhY3l

Thank you to all of the small business owners who participated in today’s Coronavirus Telephone Town Hall. I hope everyone finds the resources we discussed helpful. For more information regarding COVID-19, please visit my website. https://t.co/NYfZVwiwzK https://t.co/haZ4PQ9Lvg

When Ashley Showalter heard her grandmother was making masks for those in her retirement community, she decided to follow in her footsteps. Ashley is now making masks of her own and plans to give them away for free moving forward. Keep up the good work. https://t.co/vsrECNtClX

RT @WhiteHouse: Press Briefing with Coronavirus Task Force https://t.co/yKjFhR4TfY

While the CDC recommends using a cloth face covering when leaving the house, masks pose a choking hazard to children under the age of two, and it is recommended they not be worn. Further, personal protective equipment intended for medical professionals should not be used. https://t.co/MzsvhPWtbU

As the COVID-19 virus rages, our economy is in free fall via government fiat. Glad we have finally received a draft of the Senate coronavirus deal. I’m told that it doesn’t include the liberal riders that Speaker Pelosi wanted in it, but I’m going to spend the next several hours reading it for myself. As President Reagan used to say, “Trust, but verify.” https://t.co/8PNxwAJDUf
The @US_FDA has not approved any home testing kits for COVID-19. Those advertised are fraudulent and should not be purchased. https://t.co/d7ChET54l8
